title: Strictly’s Will Bayley danced a Pokémon Paso Doble and nobody can believe their eyes
text:
Strictly’s Will Bayley was full Pokemon trainer (Picture: BBC)

Strictly’s Will Bayley gave every 90s kid a nostalgic rush with a Pokemon Paso Doble routine.

Will and partner Janette Manrara became Pokemon trainer Ash Ketchum and Pikachu for the show’s Movie Week theme, delivering a fiery routine to the main theme.

While the song and dance itself felt like a bizarre mash-up, the judges praised the dance, with only Bruno Tonioli calling for more ‘artistry’ in his performance.

Speaking about the dance, Craig Revel Horwood said: ‘It was full of strength, it had intent and it had purpose. Well done.’

Motsi Mabuse added: ‘I loved this tension in your body. You really have a nice tension which gave you a nice shape and I loved the build up in the middle because I felt your bodies building up and then you released the power.

‘You had to keep that, I love that.’

Advertisement

Advertisement

Viewers however couldn’t quite believe their eyes.

This show is absolutely ridiculous. I love it. #Strictly — Laura Wardropper (@lauraaaclaire) October 5, 2019

Never in my wildest dreams did I think I’d see a Paso Doble to the Pokémon theme! #Strictly — Lauren (@lozzaaa13) October 5, 2019

i feel like i'm high watching this pokemon themed paso doble #Strictly pic.twitter.com/j5XGxppY3G — Cassie (@Cassiesmyth) October 5, 2019

Have I accidentally eaten a space cake? #Pokemon #Strictly — Jamie Pugh (@jamieshefinbrum) October 5, 2019

The dance earned Will and Janette the scores of six, six, five, six, earning a total of 23 points.

Will and Janette’s dance on last week’s live show earned them a score of 24, which was a Salsa to 1-2-3 by Gloria Estefan.

Strictly Come Dancing continues Sunday at 7.15pm on BBC One.

description: Strictly Come Dancing meets Pokemon in a bizarre crossover for Movie Week.
